title: Lane's World: Carousel chaos and the looming big-money battle over Kiffin
content: More than $150M in buyouts and multiple job openings mean Lane Kiffin is the center of the CFB universe.

title: Dodgers win WS classic on Freeman's HR in 18th
content: Freddie Freeman once again lifted the Dodgers with a walk-off home run in a World Series, this time in the 18th inning of Game 3 against the Blue Jays on Monday night.

title: Jays say enough's enough, won't pitch to Ohtani
content: The Blue Jays turned to walking Shohei Ohtani, who reached base a record nine times in Game 3, after he went 4-for-4 in the early innings.

title: Chapman: I'd rather retire than rejoin Yankees
content: Aroldis Chapman ripped the Yankees in a recent podcast, saying he would "retire on the spot" before playing for them ever again.

title: Flagg hurts shoulder, is benched in crunch time
content: Mavericks rookie Cooper Flagg injured his left shoulder on the opening possession of Monday night's loss and spent the vast majority of crunch time watching from the bench due to a coach's decision.

title: Senate asks Silver for info on gambling inquiries
content: A Senate committee sent a letter to NBA commissioner Adam Silver on Monday, asking for details about the league's approach to investigating potential gambling violations.

title: Kelce equals Holmes as Chiefs' career TD leader
content: Travis Kelce led the Chiefs to a comfortable win over the Commanders with six receptions on eight targets for 99 yards -- and his 83rd career touchdown, which tied former running back Priest Holmes for the most total touchdowns in franchise history.

title: Maxey, Edgecombe off to historic start for Sixers
content: Tyrese Maxey and VJ Edgecombe have combined for 186 points, the most by a starting backcourt in a team's first three games of a season since 1970-71.

title: A new team at No. 1? Patriots in the top 10? We have our latest NFL Power Rankings
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 9. Plus, we picked the best offseason signing, hiring or draft pick for each roster.

title: Who is left to pitch? What will Ohtani do next? Here's what to expect in World Series Game 4
content: Who is left to pitch? What will Ohtani do next? Here's what to expect as L.A. and Toronto return for an encore.

title: Solak: Why Drake Maye should be MVP, a defense of Caleb Williams, four trades that must happen
content: Here are four takes off the first eight weeks of the season, four trade proposals that make a ton of sense and some wild Week 8 trends to watch.

title: Five reasons Brian Kelly failed at LSU
content: Kelly's departure could be pinned on trouble with his staff, trouble fitting in or a mad scramble for Lane Kiffin.

title: Women's Bracketology: Ranking of No. 1 seeds shifts in final preseason edition
content: A key injury to South Carolina and other developments in the final weeks to tipoff shift projections.

title: Sports' mafia ties run deeper than NBA gambling scandal
content: Prosecutors say two former NBA players played in rigged poker games run by mob members. Organized crime has long exploited athletes' vulnerabilities.

title: 200 plays on a wristband?! Why some NFL QBs wear play sheets on their wrists and others don't
content: Some QBs like the way wristbands speed up the process, but others, such as Dak Prescott, don't want to lose eye contact.

title: What Carson Wentz's injury means for Vikings, J.J. McCarthy
content: Wentz proved to be a warrior, playing through a serious injury, but now it's time to see what McCarthy can do.

title: 'A moment of glory': How the daughter of two Ohio State 'i dotters' fulfilled her destiny
content: Sydney Reeves grew up with two Ohio State sousaphone players for parents. She always knew what she had to do.

title: Free agent pickups: Key adds ahead of the trade deadline
content: Highlighting available free agent options after a weekend of surprising performances ahead of Week 9.

title: Buzz: Rashee Rice delivers in Chiefs' win on 'Monday Night Football'
content: Rashee Rice is all the way back, Jacory Croskey-Merritt's limitations on display on "Monday Night Football"

title: Wardley moves up at heavyweight after KO of Parker
content: Fabio Wardley is the new WBO interim heavyweight champion and moves up five spots. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: The best players who might be available at the NFL trade deadline: Our 1-25 ranking
content: Here's how the top trade candidates -- including Trey Hendrickson, Chris Olave and even Mark Andrews -- stack up. Who is the top target to land before Nov. 4?

title: World Series Odds: Dodgers in control as MVP favorite Ohtani takes mound for Game 4
content: Odds for the Los Angeles Dodgers vs Toronto Blue Jays World Series including results, MVP and stat leaders.

title: College football futures: Is now the time to bet on Marcel Reed and Texas A&M?
content: As the odds shift for the Heisman Trophy and national title, Pamela Maldonado breaks down what to know.

title: Arne Slot's biggest test yet as Liverpool head coach: Ending this mini-crisis
content: After the dizzying highs of a league title, Liverpool's slump this term under Arne Slot has become a crisis. Can the mercurial Dutch manager turn things around?

title: Why we know Arsenal will win the Premier League (and how they could still be stopped)
content: Not even a quarter of the way through the season, we're ready to call it: Arsenal are winning it all. Unless...

title: Why all 16 playoff teams will (and won't) win MLS Cup
content: Look at the MLS playoff field long enough and you can make a case that all 16 teams have what it takes to be contenders -- or that they're pretenders.

title: 'That'll change all the narratives': Trae Young knows exactly what will silence his critics
content: The Hawks had a busy offseason that included surrounding Young with star power. Can he claim the wide-open East and prove he's worth a max deal?

title: Who's got next? Predicting five breakout players for this season
content: Which NBA players are primed to take the next step in their development? Jeremy Woo predicts the top five.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Vinícius Júnior eyes Real Madrid exit in January
content: Real Madrid forward Vinícius Júnior could seek an exit in the January transfer window. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: GHMC eyes a bounty from mapping property tax records with electricity connections
content: As part of the exercise, PTINs were being mapped with the electricity service connections (USCs) of the Telangana Southern Power Distribution Company

title: CM opens country’s first designer zoo and Asia’s second largest at Puthur
content: Built on 338 acres, the world-class Thrissur Zoological park redefines the idea of a zoo — from cages to coexistence. Designed by Australian architect Jon Coe, the park boasts nine zones that showcase diverse ecosystems.

title: Pilots slam move to dilute court order on restricted night flying to combat fatigue
content: As Air India and IndiGo secure DGCA exemptions from Delhi High Court‑mandated rest and duty limits, pilot group terms move “breach of law” and threatens contempt action

title: Muivah says NSCN (I-M) will not compromise on Naga political demands
content: If you don’t come to understand us, there is no point in our going to you, the NSCN (I-M) leader tells New Delhi from his birthplace, Somdal in Manipur

title: UAE Land Forces Commander’s visit focuses on expanding military cooperation, defence collaboration
content: Maj. Gen. Al Hallami holds discussions with General Upendra Dwivedi, Chief of Army Staff, on avenues to further deepen bilateral cooperation between the two Armies

title: BJP battles internal turmoil as it fights for third term in Palakkad
content: BJP remains confident that its 40,000-strong vote base in Palakkad municipality is intact.  Internal conflicts are rampant within both BJP and Congress. In 2020, UDF’s seat count dropped from 17 to 14 largely due to Congress’ internal discord.  LDF is likely to adopt a strategy of backing Independent candidates in certain wards

title: Butterfly, moth survey at Telangana’s Eturnagaram Wildlife Sanctuary in November
content: It is open to individuals aged 18 years and above who are fit to walk long hours and are eager to explore and learn

title: State to file review petition in Supreme Court on TET order: Lokesh
content: HRD Minister assures that while the State will comply with the Supreme Court’s directive on TET, it will also seek relief through a review petition to safeguard the interests of in-service teachers

title: State govt. confident of bringing Hollywood to Hyderabad: CM
content: Chief Minister says that workers should be given 20% share in the profits earned by the films while addressing a meeting organised by the Telugu Film Workers’ Associations

title: Field studies in Kozhikode to identify reasons for surge in amoebic meningoencephalitis in Kerala
content: Health dept. and scientists at ICMR-National Institute of Epidemiology will continue field studies in Malappuram, Thiruvananthapuram and Kollam too, which account for a significant number of the amoebic infections reported in 2024, 2025

title: MNF calls for 10-hour shutdown in Mizoram on October 28 to protest extension of Forest Act in State
content: “People and vehicles under emergency services will be exempted from the strike,” MNF media and publicity cell secretary Lallenmawia Jongte said.

title: Live Updates: Cyclone Montha Landfall Begins, Heavy Rain, Strong Winds On Andhra Coast
content: Cyclone Montha LIVE updates: Cylone Montha is expected to cross the Andhra Pradesh coast between Machilipatnam and Kalingapatnam around Kakinada on Tuesday evening as a severe cyclonic storm.

title: On Grand Alliance's Bihar Manifesto, Pictures Say A Thousand Words
content: The Grand Alliance might have stolen a march on the NDA by bringing out its manifesto first, but the presentation of the images of Tejashwi Yadav and Rahul Gandhi is expected to invite some barbs.

title: 'Even Musk's AI Encyclopedia Needs Us To Exist': Wikipedia's Dig At Grokipedia
content: TheWikipedia page was created hours after Grokipedia went live on October 27. It describes Grokipedia as an "artificial intelligence-powered online encyclopedia developed by xAI, an artificial intelligence company founded by Elon Musk."

title: "Behen Hai Meri": Siblings Claim Cops Harassed Them At Bihar Eatery
content: A video of a Bihar police officer allegedly misbehaving with a man and a woman after they told him they were siblings has sparked outrage on social media.

title: Cyclone Montha Moving Towards Andhra Coast, Landfall At Midnight: 10 Points
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued red and orange alerts for several southern Odisha districts as Cyclone Montha intensified into a severe cyclonic storm over the west-central Bay of Bengal

title: No Timeframe Set For Siddaramaiah's Tenure: Karnataka Home Minister
content: Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara on Tuesday said when Siddaramaiah was elected leader of the Congress Legislature Party after the 2023 Assembly polls to become the chief minister, no timeframe was specified for his tenure.

title: Graffiti Of Lawrence Bishnoi Found On Tipu Sultan's Palace Wall; Case Filed
content: An FIR has been registered against unidentified persons after they allegedly defaced the wall of Tipu Sultan's Palace atop Nandi Hills with graffiti referring to gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, police said on Tuesday.

title: Man, Daughter Burnt To Death As Bus Catches Fire After It Hits High-Tension Wire
content: A man and his 20-year-old daughter died when a bus they were travelling in came in contact with a high-tension power line and caught fire around 50 km from Jaipur on Tuesday morning.

title: From Trump To Trade: 5 Takeaways From This Year's ASEAN Summit
content: The Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) concluded on Tuesday its biannual summit attended by foreign leaders, including US President Donald Trump, with trade and regional tensions on the agenda.

title: Trump Dances To 'YMCA' With Marines Aboard US Aircraft Carrier In Japan
content: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday danced with sailors and Navy personnel aboard the USS George Washington during his visit to Japan, part of a wider tour across Asia.

title: After Doctor Suicide, Someone Used Her Fingerprint To Delete Data On Phone: Family
content: The relatives of the woman doctor, who allegedly committed suicide in Maharashtra's Satara district last week, have claimed that someone used the victim's fingerprint to unlock her phone after her death and erased vital information from it.

title: Indian Man Stabs Two Teens With Metal Fork On US-Germany Flight, Arrested
content: An Indian national, Praneeth Kumar Usiripalli, has been charged in the US with allegedly stabbing two teenagers with a metal fork and slapping a passenger on board a Lufthansa flight.

title: Adani Green Energy's Net Profit Grows 28% To Rs 644 Crore In Second Quarter
content: Adani Green Energy Ltd (AGEL) on Tuesday posted a 28 per cent year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit to Rs 644 crore in the September quarter, driven by the renewable power business.

title: How A Ford "Hot Truck" Became The Star Of Japan-US Trade Diplomacy
content: Long associated with American ruggedness, burly pickup trucks such as Ford's top-selling F-150 have now become a symbol of international trade talks, showing how far countries such as Japan will go to win over US President Donald Trump.

title: As Amazon Doubles Down On AI, 14,000 Corporate Roles Face The Axe
content: Amazon will cut about 14,000 corporate jobs as the online retail giant ramps up spending on artificial intelligence while trimming spending.

title: Ukraine Ready To Talk Peace, But Not To Surrender More Land: Zelensky
content: Ukraine is ready for peace talks but will not withdraw its troops from additional territory first, as Moscow has demanded, President Volodymyr Zelensky said.

title: "People Will Send DMK Home": TVK Chief Vijay Over Crop Damage In Tamil Nadu
content: Actor-politician Vijay has questioned the ruling DMK government in Tamil Nadu for failing to protect farmers whose grains were damaged during the recent rainfall.

title: Kenya Plane Crash Kills 10 Foreigners Heading To Maasai Mara National Park
content: A small plane travelling from Kenya's coast crashed on Tuesday, killing all 11 people, including foreigners, on board, the airline said.

title: 'Every Vote Matters': Haryana BJP Launches Campaign To Send Migrant Voters Home For Bihar Polls
content: The Haryana unit of the BJP has launched a large-scale mobilisation drive to send lakhs of Bihari migrant workers back to their home state to cast their votes in the upcoming assembly elections.

title: Two killed as sleeper bus catches fire after hitting high-tension power line in Rajasthan
content: Some household items, gas cylinders and two-wheelers kept on the roof of the bus touched an 11 kV electricity line when the vehicle was crossing an internal road near a village 55 km from Jaipur; 10 persons were injured

title: Cap on remittance leaves Indian diaspora in Maldives in the lurch
content: The Indian community in the Maldives is feeling the pinch after the State Bank of India (SBI) slapped a $150 cap on monthly remittances, leaving many expats struggling to support their families back home.

title: New admission directive puts Kerala University at odds with Juvenile Justice Act
content: A recent circular issued by Kerala University  requires students applying for admission to submit a self-declaration stating that they have not been charged with or punished for any criminal offences

title: Corporate world rewards hard work, punishes lethargy, says V-C
content: He was speaking at the inaugural session of a seminar at the Doddappa Appa Sabha Mantap on Sharnbasva University campus

title: Education must be a tool of service, leadership and transformation, says APSCHE Chairman
content: SRM-AP University confers degrees to 1,877 graduates and 39 doctoral scholars during their fifth convocation event in Guntur

title: Cyclone Montha: standing crops over 43,000 hectares inundated in A.P.
content: 83,000 farmers across 292 mandals and 1,712 villages affected; paddy and cotton are the worst hit, accounting for more than 80% of the total damaged area

title: Sharnbasva University signs MoU with The Hindu Group to benefit students
content: The partnership envisages a series of academic and co-curricular engagements under two key initiatives

title: 32% candidates in phase-I Bihar polls face criminal cases: ADR
content: CPI(ML) has the largest number of candidates with criminal cases (93%), followed by RJD (76%) and BJP (65%)

title: Five perceptions dominate the Bihar Assembly election campaign this time
content: CM Nitish Kumar is still popular but voters discuss his failing health; PM Narendra Modi’s leadership finds many admirers; Tejashwi Yadav is burdened by his parents’ legacy of ‘lawlessness’; Prashant Kishor’s Jan Suraaj Party is missing on the ground; after decades, the Congress is back in the reckoning

title: Dharwad to complain to State govt. against L&T’s deficiency in service
content: ‘The company which is in charge of implementing drinking water projects in rural areas has failed to complete the works within the stipulated time’

title: Murari Babu sent in SIT custody, to be interrogated together with Potti
content: The SIT has sought additional documents  from TDB in connection with the gold-plating work at Sabarimala undertaken by Vijay Mallya in 1999

title: Advika Trading scam: couple, two agents arrested for duping customers
content: Established in 2022, Advika Trading Company collected close to ₹400 crore from 1,450 customers, investigation revealed

title: Make Kalaburagi child marriage-free, officials told
content: Concern over the increasing number of child marriage cases reported in the district in the recent days

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Unsafe drinking water fuels antimicrobial resistance among isolated tribal communities in Kerala, Karnataka and Tamil Nadu: study
content: Findings underscore urgent need for safe water access, environmental surveillance and resistome-informed public health strategies

title: Chittapur RSS route march: Peace meeting ends in acrimony, stalemate
content: Tension flared up when some organisations proposed that RSS be allowed to hold its route march only if its volunteers agree to give up lathis and instead carry the national flag and copies of the Constitution’s Preamble.

title: Shreyas Iyer out of danger, recovering 'faster than expected'; shifted out of ICU
content: Indian batter Shreyas Iyer is recovering remarkably well from a spleen injury, exceeding medical expectations. He has been moved out of the ICU and is reportedly in good spirits. Meanwhile, India's women's opener Pratika Rawal faces a four to six-month layoff due to a knee injury, with Shafali Verma named as her replacement.

title: Bihar polls: Chirag Paswan backs Nitish as NDA's CM face; clarifies Shah's remark
content: Union minister Chirag Paswan has affirmed Nitish Kumar as the NDA's chief ministerial candidate for Bihar polls, echoing Amit Shah's stance. Paswan criticised the INDIA bloc's projection of Tejashwi Yadav, linking it to past 'jungle raj' fears. Bihar will vote in two phases on November 6 and 11, with results to be declared on November 14.

title: Apple hits record! Becomes third tech giant to cross $4 trillion valuation
content: Apple has achieved a historic $4 trillion market value, driven by robust demand for its new iPhone 17 and iPhone Air lineup. This surge in sales, particularly in the US and China, has boosted Apple's stock and offset concerns about its slower AI progress.

title: 30,000 layoffs at Amazon: Managers receive email; HR division faces deepest cuts
content: Amazon initiated urgent manager training on October 27, preceding notifications to up to 30,000 corporate employees about layoffs starting the next day. These cuts, impacting nearly 10% of its corporate workforce across various divisions, represent the company's largest job reduction. The move comes amid aggressive cost-cutting and significant AI investments, with a strict return-to-office policy failing to reduce staff voluntarily.

title: ‘Even Lord Indra isn’t with them’: AAP mocks BJP govt’s artificial rain drive in Delhi - video
content: AAP leader Saurabh Bharadwaj criticized the BJP-led Delhi government's artificial rain experiment, calling it a failed attempt to combat air pollution. He alleged the government claimed credit for predicted natural rainfall, humorously stating even "Lord Indra isn’t on their side." The cloud seeding operation, intended to trigger rain, yielded no significant results by late evening.

title: Qualcomm CEO warns: Don't predict the AI winners yet; there may be changes
content: Qualcomm's CEO Cristiano Amon cautions against early AI dominance predictions, stating it's too soon to name winners. He likens AI's potential to the dotcom boom but on a larger scale. Despite warnings of an AI bubble from industry leaders like OpenAI and Meta CEOs, major tech firms continue massive investments, recognizing AI's significant long-term opportunity.

title: Hurricane Melissa: Jamaica braces for catastrophic storm; 7 dead across Caribbean
content: Hurricane Melissa, a Category 5 storm, is strengthening as it heads towards Jamaica, with officials warning of catastrophic winds and floods. This is the strongest storm ever recorded to strike the island, prompting mandatory evacuations and fears of widespread devastation. Relief efforts are being prepared as the nation braces for impact.

title: Shardul’s strong message to Agarkar: ‘Eyeing No. 8 all-rounder spot at 2027 World Cup’
content: Shardul Thakur is targeting a comeback to the Indian ODI team, specifically eyeing the all-rounder spot at No. 8 for the 2027 World Cup in South Africa.  Despite being overlooked recently, Thakur remains confident in his readiness for international cricket. He also praised young spinner Himanshu Singh's performance and encouraged Shams Mulani.

title: Burevestnik N-powered missile: Hype or tech breakthrough?
content: Russia claims a successful test of its nuclear-powered cruise missile, Burevestnik, boasting limitless range and stealth. This development revives interest in nuclear air propulsion, a Cold War concept abandoned due to safety and technical hurdles. While its invincibility is debated, the missile's potential impact on arms control and future space exploration is significant.

title: ChatGPT Go subscription now free: Offer starts November 4; Who are eligible users
content: OpenAI is making its ChatGPT Go subscription free for all Indian users for a year, starting November 4. This strategic move targets India, the company's second-largest and fastest-growing market, in response to aggressive user acquisition by rivals Google and Perplexity.

title: How Ozempic is deflating America's wasteline
content: According to the Gallup National Health and Well-Being Index, America’s adult obesity rate has fallen to 37% in 2025, down from 39.9% in 2022 — a small but significant drop after decades of stagnation. Over the same period, the number of people taking injectable anti-obesity drugs more than doubled, from 5.8% to 12.4%. Coincidence? Perhaps. But correlation has rarely looked this convincing.

title: Ryan Kesler misconduct case: Wife Andrea Kesler stands by ex-NHL star amid scandal
content: Former NHL center Ryan Kesler faces two counts of fourth-degree criminal sexual conduct in Michigan following a January 1 incident. Police investigated for nearly 10 months before filing charges against the 41-year-old, who pleaded not guilty and was released on bond. His wife, Andrea Kesler, is reportedly standing by him amid the legal scrutiny.

title: Bihar polls: Rahul Gandhi skips MGB presser; joint manifesto released in Patna
content: The Mahagathbandhan unveiled its joint manifesto for the Bihar Assembly elections, branded as "Tejashwi’s Prann," with a prominent image of RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav. Rahul Gandhi's absence from the state was noted, though he made a digital appearance.

title: Cyclone Montha: Sea turns rough off Kakinada-Uppada beach amid strong winds - watch video
content: Cyclone Montha is set to make landfall near Kakinada, Andhra Pradesh, as a severe cyclonic storm with winds up to 110 kmph. Coastal regions of Andhra Pradesh, Odisha, and Telangana are bracing for impact. Over 35 flights have been cancelled, and 10 trains are affected as authorities remain on high alert.

title: 8th Pay Commission: Good news for govt employees! Cabinet approves terms of reference
content: Central government employees have reason to celebrate as the Union Cabinet approved the Terms of Reference for the 8th Pay Commission. This temporary body will review salaries and benefits, with recommendations expected within 18 months, aiming for implementation by January 1, 2026.

title: Bihar polls: Mahagathbandhan releases manifesto titled 'Tejashwi prann' – key takeaways
content: The RJD-Congress-led Mahagathbandhan has unveiled its manifesto, "Bihar ka Tejashwi Prann," for the upcoming Bihar elections, promising significant changes. Key pledges include one government job per family within 20 days of forming the government, restoration of the Old Pension Scheme, and Rs 2,500 monthly for women under the Mai-Behin Maan Yojana, alongside 200 units of free electricity.

title: Cyclone Montha landfall: Path, affected states, wind speed - all your questions answered
content: Cyclone Montha, a severe cyclonic storm named by Thailand, is set to make landfall on India's east coast near Kakinada, Andhra Pradesh, on the evening of October 28, 2025. The storm, with sustained winds of 90-110 km/h, will bring heavy rainfall and strong winds to coastal Andhra Pradesh and Odisha, with potential impacts extending to neighboring states.

title: Satish Shah's real cause of death revealed: Co-star says it wasn't kidney failure
content: Veteran actor Satish Shah's demise was initially attributed to kidney failure, but co-star Rajesh Kumar clarified it was a sudden heart attack. Shah, known for 'Sarabhai vs Sarabhai', passed away at home during lunch. His colleagues remember his enduring passion for work despite health challenges. A prayer meet was held in Mumbai.

title: Ranji Trophy: Shami speaks out on selection snub again - ‘Mai bolunga to bawal...’
content: Senior India pacer Mohammed Shami has returned to competitive cricket. He stated that playing for Bengal is a matter of passion, not a comeback. Shami delivered an impressive performance with five wickets in the second innings. He has been dealing with injuries since the 2023 World Cup. Shami also commented on media scrutiny and social media perceptions.

title: ‘Flaunted IIT degree, failed Delhi’: BJP slams Arvind Kejriwal's rule
content: The BJP criticised former Delhi CM Kejriwal for his alleged failure to address the city's pollution crisis, citing issues with the Yamuna River and air quality. BJP IT cell head Amit Malviya accused Kejriwal of delivering excuses instead of results, contrasting it with the BJP's claimed achievements under Rekha Gupta in attempt of cleaning the Yamuna and implementing anti-pollution measures like cloud seeding.

title: Delhi horror: How racy clips, rekindled romance led to murder; forensic grad scripted fiery cover-up
content: In a tale of passion turned peril, Ramkesh Meena and Amrita Chauhan found their love story interrupted by the shadow of Amrita's former flame, Sumit Kashyap. When intimate footage emerged, a desperate attempt to reclaim control spiraled into chaos with a botched robbery that ended in tragedy for Ramkesh.

title: Japan’s mysterious ghost plants reveal how life survives and grows in darkness
content: Japanese botanist Kenji Suetsugu's childhood fascination with ghost flowers led to a career uncovering their secrets. These unique mycoheterotrophic plants survive without photosynthesis by parasitizing fungi, challenging biological norms. Suetsugu's research revealed their reliance on camel crickets for seed dispersal and tiny insects for pollination, even discovering new species and a rare plant genus.

title: Trouble for Surya? Ex-India coach warns of 'internal scrutiny' if poor form continues
content: Former India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar anticipates Suryakumar Yadav's batting form will improve in Australia, citing the pitches' pace and bounce suiting his style. Despite recent struggles, Nayar believes the tour offers a chance for the T20I captain to rediscover his potent capabilities.

title: Dual voter ID row: EC notice to Prashant Kishor over name in Bihar, Bengal rolls
content: The Election Commission has issued a notice to Jan Suraaj founder Prashant Kishor, demanding clarification within three days. Officials discovered Kishor is registered as a voter in both Bihar and West Bengal.  He is listed at the TMC headquarters in Kolkata and also in Bihar's Rohtas district, prompting the poll body's inquiry.

title: Delhi airport fire alert: Air India bus erupts in blaze near aircraft - Watch
content: A bus operated by AI SATS caught fire near an aircraft at Delhi Airport's Terminal 3 on Tuesday morning. Fortunately, the coach was empty, and no passengers were onboard at the time of the incident. The blaze was swiftly controlled, with no injuries or damage to nearby aircraft reported.

title: 15 wickets in 2 games! Md Shami sends a stern message to Ajit Agarkar and co
content: Mohammed Shami has made a compelling case for his return to the Indian squad with a sensational Ranji Trophy campaign for Bengal. The veteran pacer has claimed an impressive 15 wickets in just two matches, including an eight-wicket haul against Gujarat. This dominant form directly addresses recent comments from selectors regarding his need for game time.

title: Watch: UP cop kicks man on camera; suspended after video goes viral
content: A viral video shows a Uttar Pradesh policeman kicking a complainant. The officer, Abhishek Kumar, was suspended after the incident, which occurred when he reacted to a man filming and speaking about oppression. The police have assured a thorough investigation into the matter.

title: Mid-air drama: Indian passenger stabs two teens with fork, slaps woman
content: An Indian national, Praneeth Kumar Usiripalli, faces federal charges after allegedly stabbing two teenagers with a fork and assaulting a flight attendant on a Lufthansa flight from Chicago to Germany. The incident forced the plane to divert to Boston, where Usiripalli was apprehended. He was previously in the US on a student visa but now lacks lawful status.

title: Amazon confirms it is cutting thousands of jobs, ramps up spending on AI; read HR head's letter
content: Amazon is slashing approximately 14,000 corporate jobs, citing a need for leaner operations and faster innovation driven by AI. Senior Vice President Beth Galetti announced the cuts, emphasizing a shift towards fewer layers and increased ownership to better serve customers. This move aims to streamline the company and invest in key strategic areas.

title: IND vs AUS: 'He must perform' - Ex-India cricketer issues strong warning to Gill
content: Shubman Gill faces immense pressure in the upcoming T20I series against Australia due to his poor Asia Cup form and stiff competition from Yashasvi Jaiswal and Sanju Samson.  Head coach Gautam Gambhir's T20 World Cup plans will be scrutinized as Gill, now vice-captain, must justify the team's faith after Samson was moved down the order.

title: Cyclone Montha: Flights & trains cancelled, red alert issued as 3 states brace for landfall — key points
content: Cyclone Montha is set to make landfall near Kakinada tonight, bringing heavy rains and winds up to 110 kmph to Andhra Pradesh, Odisha, and northern Tamil Nadu. Authorities have initiated massive evacuations, deployed rescue teams, and are preparing for potential power and communication disruptions.

title: Travis Kelce: Reporter calls him ‘Travis Scott’; Mahomes’ reaction goes viral
content: Kansas City Chiefs secured a dominant 28-7 victory over the Washington Commanders. Tight end Travis Kelce achieved a franchise milestone, tying the record for career regular-season touchdowns. During a post-game interview, ESPN's Lisa Salters humorously misidentified Kelce as 'Travis Scott,' a moment that added levity to the night. Kelce also shared his appreciation for his career, cherishing each game.

title: Big Aatmanirbhar push! Passenger aircraft to be built in India; HAL, Russia’s UAC sign pact
content: India is set to manufacture the SJ-100 civil commuter aircraft in a significant collaboration between HAL and Russia's UAC. This pact aims to boost regional air connectivity and domestic manufacturing, marking a new era for India's aviation industry. The project is expected to meet substantial demand for regional jets and foster private sector involvement.

title: Delhi set for artificial rain: What is cloud seeding? How it's done and the science behind it
content: Delhi is set to attempt artificial rainfall today. This cloud seeding operation aims to clear the city's toxic air. The trial depends on weather conditions in Kanpur. If successful, it could bring much-needed rain to wash out pollutants. This is a joint project by IIT Kanpur and the Delhi Government. It is the fourth attempt to curb severe air pollution.

title: What IS 3I/ATLAS: The Comet that’s breaking all the solar system rules
content: A peculiar interstellar visitor, 3I/ATLAS, is challenging comet theories with its sunward tail and unusual composition. While scientists explore natural explanations for its behavior, the object's unique characteristics have sparked discussions about potential non-natural origins. Continued observations are crucial to understanding its true nature and implications for distant star systems.

title: Jay-Z stands up to Donald Trump amid backlash over Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl show
content: Puerto Rican superstar Bad Bunny is set to headline Super Bowl LX, marking a historic moment as the first primarily Spanish-language solo artist. Despite some criticism, Jay-Z lauded his impact, while Bad Bunny humorously urged critics to learn Spanish. This performance promises a vibrant celebration of Latin culture on the world's biggest stage.

title: Trump sanctions: Indian refiners stop placing new orders for Russian oil; await clarity from govt
content: Indian oil refiners are halting new Russian crude orders following fresh US and EU sanctions targeting Russian energy giants. This strategic shift, driven by a need for clarity and payment facilitation, sees India increasing imports from the US and Middle Eastern nations.

title: Phil Hughes to Shreyas Iyer: A list of freak injuries on cricket field
content: India's vice-captain Shreyas Iyer is hospitalized in Sydney with a laceration injury to his spleen, sustained during a spectacular catch against Australia. The impact caused internal bleeding, leading to a sharp drop in his blood pressure. This incident adds to cricket's history of serious on-field injuries.

title: Watch: Suspect who fatally shot US cop crashes into car during high-speed chase
content: A manhunt concluded Monday after a motorcyclist, accused of fatally shooting San Bernardino County Sheriff's Deputy Andrew Nunez during a domestic violence call, crashed on the 210 Freeway. The suspect, who led authorities on a high-speed pursuit, was apprehended near Ontario. A firearm was found at the scene. The suspect's condition is currently unknown.

title: Strongest storm in 174 yrs: Video captures lightning flashes within eye of Hurricane Melissa - Watch
content: Category 5 Hurricane Melissa has stunned the world with jaw-dropping videos from its eye, captured by U.S. Air Force "Hurricane Hunters." The storm made landfall in Jamaica, bringing devastating winds and flooding, prompting the Prime Minister to call it the island's most violent in recorded history. Cuba and the Bahamas are now bracing for its impact.

title: MCX trading halted! Exchange sees tech glitch; trading in gold & silver delayed
content: The Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) experienced a significant technical disruption on Tuesday, leading to a four-hour trading suspension. Futures contracts for key commodities like gold and silver were impacted.

title: Kenya plane crash: 12 people on board feared dead; victims mostly tourists
content: A light aircraft carrying tourists crashed in Kwale County on Tuesday morning, with at least 12 people feared dead. The plane, en route from Diani to Kichwa Tembo, went down around 8:30 am. Authorities are investigating the cause, with poor visibility and weather suspected factors.

title: United Center's mozzarella pucks lead latest NHL, NBA arena food
content: The 2025-26 NBA and NHL seasons are underway, which means fans are filing into arenas again and concession stands will be getting creative to serve the masses. Among those creations are the crispy mozzarella pucks that will be sold only at  Chicago Blackhawks ' games at the United Center. The parmesan herb-breaded mozzarella sticks -- or in this case pucks -- are sold with homemade marinara sauce. Here are some other innovations that can be found at NBA and NHL arenas across the campaigns.

title: How the FBI says poker games were rigged
content: the case focused on rigged poker games is one of two announced that allegedly involve prominent NBA figures . investigators state that the scheme began in April 2019 when defendant Robert "Black Rob" Stroud and other co-conspirators devised a ruse to use technology to rig illegal poker games against unwitting, wealthy players . in many cases, every other person at the poker table at the same time believed these were "straight" games against other wealthy players.

title: New UFC champion Mackenzie Dern moves up in strawweight top 10
content: Virna Jandiroba won the women's strawweight title on tuesday . the 115-pound heavyweight vacated by Zhang weili . dern moves up four spots to no. 2, right behind Zhang . he remains no. 2 after his split-decision win over Jailton Almeida .

title: The 10 biggest women's NCAA basketball questions for 2025-26
content: the UConn Huskies won their fourth consecutive NCAA women's basketball title (11th overall) in 2016 . last season, they dominated Final Four foes UCLA and South Carolina . the team is ranked no. 1 in the preseason poll despite losing standout Paige Bueckers .

title: The top reason to watch every NHL team in the Frozen Frenzy
content: all 32 teams in action from 6 p.m. ET puck drops through the Battle of California showdown between the Los Angeles Kings and San Jose Sharks . fans will be able to sample all the NHL has to offer in one gluttonous sitting . here we go ... and enjoy the Frenzy!

title: Rink report: The most intriguing Frozen Frenzy matchups to watch
content: all 32 teams are in action on the "Hockey Christmas" day . the night includes a tripleheader on ESPN . a red zone-style whip-around show hosted by John Buccigross and Kevin Weekes .

title: 'When we were at our lowest, the man didn't blink': What Cade Cunningham is building in Detroit
content: Cade Cunningham lost the ball on offense, but gets it back for the Pistons with a chasedown block . he had just become a first-time All-Star and the driving fo foe . his first postseason win since 2008 was in the playoffs .

title: Kelce has season-best performance in win over Commanders
content: the first time the Chiefs quarterback threw the ball to tight end Travis Kelce . the game resulted in a 1-yard loss to the Washington Commanders on monday night . his 10-yard touchdown was historic, as his 83rd career score tied Priest Holmes for the most total touchdowns in Chiefs franchise history .

title: Where LSU ranks among the open Power 4 jobs
content: the 2025-26 coaching cycle wasn't expected to be calm, like its predecessor . but few forecast such a robust line of storms rolling through the sport in the first half of the season . the ouster of James Franklin sent a message around the sport: Almost no coach is safe .

title: Barnwell makes sense of Week 8: One key takeaway from each of Sunday's 11 games
content: 11 of the 12 games we've seen so far in Week 8 have been decided by 10 or more points . eight of the 24 teams that have played so far were not able to start their preferred quarterback . a backup QB will become the ninth backup to start this week when he takes the field .

title: Ohtani, Freeman, Kershaw, Klein: The Dodgers' many heroes of Game 3
content: the 18th inning ended at 11:50 p.m. PT on monday . the los Angeles Dodgers and blue Jays competed at an exceptional level in the longest game in world Series history by innings and second longest by time . they punched and counterpunched, emptied their benches and bullpens .

title: 📊 Men's Bracketology: Houston tops No. 1 seeds
content: the 2025-26 campaign will finally tip off Nov. 3 . the last preseason edition of Bracketology will begin Nov. 11 . san francisco's jimmy mccarthy's men's basketball team is the best team of the year .

title: Ex-NHL star Kesler faces sexual conduct charges
content: former NHL center pleaded not guilty to two misdemeanor counts of criminal sexual conduct . he has denied the charges stemming from an alleged incident on Jan. 1 in Orchard Lake, Michigan . his next court appearance is set for Nov. 6 .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do after Week 9
content: there's only one month left in the regular season, and Saturday will be the last chance for teams to make an impression on the College Football Playoff selection committee before the first of six rankings is revealed . the ACC continues to lead the way with more than a 95% chance to send at least four teams to the playoff, followed by the Big Ten, with a 65% chance to have three teams .
